page.title: 06ARABLE FARMING/TEST VALLEY
page.content: The land on Broadlands Farm is mainly flat,near to the river Test.It is part of the floodplain and sometimes the river breaks its banks and floods the fields in winter.Twelve hectares are marshy and ditches have been dug to drain this.The rest is gently sloping, bar ten hectares,which are too steep for farm machinery. There is silty soil in the valley and gravel and sand on the slopes.Some soil is thin and dry,and needs fertilisers.They use potash,phosphates and nitrates with some trace elements. The most important crop is wheat which is sold to the millers,oil seed rape,sold to the crushers,barley and herbage seed,which goes to the seed merchants.This year,for the first time,they started growing peas,which together with feed wheat,are used to feed livestock on the farm.
